briefTitle: High-Flow Nasal Cannula and Desaturation Episodes in the Morbidly Obese Patients
officialTitle: Use of High-Flow Nasal Cannula to Prevent Desaturation Episodes in the Morbidly Obese Patients Undergoing Colonoscopy:A Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age between 18-80
* Subjects undergoing colonoscopies
* Morbidly obese BMI â‰¥ 40

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subjects deemed hemodynamically unstable by the anesthesia team
* Subjects who are an aspiration risk and will require endotracheal intubation.
* Pregnancy
* Subjects with an allergy to propofol
* Patients who are unable to tolerate the high flow nasal cannula secondary to discomfort
* Subjects unwilling to sign consent
* Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
* Patients that received medications other than lidocaine and propofol

primary.description: The number of desaturation episodes defined as blood oxygen saturation (SpO2) below 90% during the perioperative period during colonoscopy.
